Agents are changing the way GenAI applications are built and has become a fundamental building block between data & LLMs. With a widely accepted standard like MCP, it is set to take off exponentially in the coming months/years. items.title: "Will No One Rid Me of This Turbulent Priest?": Trump‚Äôs Fed War
items.author: Patrick Boyle
items.content:
<article>If you are curious and want to try it yourself, Tailor Store is offering 25% off your order for my viewers. Use my link https://www.tailorstore.com/patrickboyle so you can take a look whenever it suits you.

In a highly unusual move - the Department of Justice has opened a criminal investigation into Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell. As America faces a high-stakes standoff over the future of the Federal Reserve, the traditional independence of the nation‚Äôs central bank is under direct attack. This video explores the intensifying war between the White House and Fed Chair, over a $2.5 billion headquarters renovation. We break down why many experts believe this probe is a mere pretext intended to bully the Fed into slashing interest rates to rock-bottom levels, potentially putting the long-term stability of the U.S. economy at risk for short-term political gains.

We also take a closer look at the "agents of chaos" Bill Pulte, Judge Jeanine Pirro and the "shadow" economic strategies currently in play, from the FHFA‚Äôs controversial bond-buying programs to the proposed 10% cap on credit card interest rates. From the strategic blockade in the Senate by Senator Thom Tillis to the "Miran Limbo" on the Fed‚Äôs Board of Governors, we unpack the technical and political maneuvers being used to bypass Jerome Powell. Is the U.S. headed toward a "banana republic" risk premium, or can its institutional guardrails hold firm? Join us as we examine the true price of a political Fed and what it means for the future of the dollar.

items.title: Urban foraging for food - Fresh, tasty and free | DW Documentary
items.author: DW Documentary
items.content:
<article>More and more city dwellers are collecting food in the asphalt jungle. They harvest herbs by the roadside and grow wild vegetables in cracks in the concrete. For these modern foragers and hunters, the food is free, tasty and more varied than in the supermarket.

Christian Amys is an urban foraging professional. He forages for fresh food in his hometown of Brighton. For him, the English coastal city is an urban Garden of Eden. Christian finds wild vegetables and herbs in places where most people would never expect to find food. The 42-year-old only spends a few pounds a week on food from the supermarket: "I want to be independent and don't like to rely on the supermarket. I like to forage on my doorstep because it's nice to know where my food comes from."

Christian Amys worked as a top chef for 20 years before becoming an urban forager. Today, he shows others where to find wild fennel, hogweed, pineapple weed and dandelion heads and how to use them in food preparation. Christian now even supplies top restaurants and cocktail bars with his wild delicacies.

Alexis Goertz also looks for her food on the roadside and in parks. The Canadian has lived in Berlin for over 10 years. She preserves what she collects using the centuries-old technique of fermentation. Whether it's evening primrose capers, wild garlic kimchi or goutweed sauerkraut - for Alexis, fermentation is about more than just preservation: "Above all, fermentation makes food tastier and easier to digest. And I've just become addicted to it."

Alexis regularly invites people to join her on urban herb walks and explains what‚Äôs edible - and what‚Äôs poisonous. The 33-year-old is all about rediscovering nature in the city: "Berlin is fantastic for foraging for food. The diversity is immense. Not just among the people, but also in nature."

items.title: Can science create the perfect meal? | DW Documentary
items.author: DW Documentary
items.content:
<article>The Mediterranean diet is known around the world for its health benefits and was acknowledged as an intangible cultural heritage in 2010 by UNESCO. This diet consists mainly of plant-based ingredients like vegetables, whole grains, nuts, and fruits with a moderate amount of fish and dairy products.  

The food we eat has a big influence on our health as it is one of the leading causes of chronic diseases. According to the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), nearly half of all American adults now live with diet-related chronic diseases.   

More than half the average diet in the U.S. now consists of ultra-processed food. But for some younger, lower-income communities, ultra-processed food can typically make up as much as 80% of their diet.

items.title: I Switched to French for This Episode (New Year Special) | How to make a creme frangipane
items.author: French Cooking Academy
items.content:
<article>Bonjour √† tous les gourmands ! Pour bien d√©marrer l'ann√©e 2026, je vous propose un √©pisode sp√©cial et 100% en fran√ßais de la French Cooking Academy,  pour vous emmener dans l'univers de la p√¢tisserie fran√ßaise. Aujourd'hui, on s'attaque √† un classique ind√©modable : la cr√®me frangipane, le c≈ìur de notre c√©l√®bre Galette des Rois ! üëë

üåü Key Ingredients | Les Ingr√©dients Cl√©s üåü

ü•õ For the Pastry Cream (Cr√®me P√¢tissi√®re)
200 ml whole milk ü•õ
2 egg yolks ü•ö
50 g sugar
10 g cornstarch (Ma√Øzena)
10 g plain flour
1/2 vanilla bean (or 1 tsp vanilla extract for ease!) ‚ú®
Kirsch (optional, for that unique aromatic touch!) üçí

üßà For the Almond Cream (Cr√®me d‚ÄôAmande)
100 g soft butter (room temperature, like a pomade) üßà
100 g sugar
100 g eggs (about 2 medium, room temperature) ü•ö
100 g ground almonds / almond meal üå∞
A few drops of bitter almond extract (this stuff is potent, use sparingly!)
1 tsp flour (optional, for extra stability)

üå∞ The Almond Cream Secrets | Les Secrets de la Cr√®me d‚ÄôAmande ü§´
3 Golden Rules for Perfection!
Temperature is Key! üå°Ô∏è Make sure both your butter and eggs are at room temperature. This is crucial for a smooth emulsion!
Cream it Right! Start by creaming the soft butter until pale. Then, gradually beat in the sugar, followed by the eggs, little by little. Get ready for a beautifully smooth mix! ü•£
Fold Gently! Gently fold in your sifted almond meal and those precious drops of bitter almond extract. Don't overmix!
Chill Out! Pop it in the fridge to chill until you're ready to assemble. 

üëë Assembly & Baking | Assemblage & Cuisson üëë
It's time to bring it all together for your masterpiece!
Loosen Up! Take your cold pastry cream and loosen it with a splash of Kirsch. Then, gently fold it into your almond cream until everything is beautifully combined. Voil√†, your frangipane is ready!
Fill & Seal! Grab your puff pastry, generously fill it with the frangipane (psst... don't forget the f√®ve if you're making a real Galette des Rois! ). Then, seal those edges really well to keep all that deliciousness inside!

Final touches: 
 Give your creation a beautiful egg wash for that golden shine, decorate as you like, and then let it rest in the fridge for 20 minutes. This helps the pastry hold its shape! ‚ú®
Bake to Perfection! Preheat your oven to a hot 200 ¬∞C / 390 ¬∞F and bake for 30‚Äì40 minutes until deeply golden brown and puffed up! Keep an eye on it! oven

M√™me si ma galette a eu un petit "accident" esth√©tique (trop g√©n√©reux en cr√®me !), le go√ªt est DIVIN ! Ne vous inqui√©tez pas si la v√¥tre n'est pas parfaite, l'important c'est le plaisir ! üòã

Martin Luther King Jr. was one of the most important leaders in modern history. In this full biography documentary, we explore the life, legacy and assassination of Martin Luther King Jr., the most famous voice of the American civil rights movement. 

From his childhood in segregated America to his rise as a Baptist minister, civil rights leader and Nobel Peace Prize winner, this video tells the complete story of Martin Luther King Jr.
Discover how MLK led the Montgomery Bus Boycott, the Birmingham Campaign and the March on Washington, where he delivered the iconic ‚ÄúI Have a Dream‚Äù speech. We examine his philosophy of nonviolent protest, his relationship with other civil rights activists, and his battles against racism, segregation and injustice in the United States.

This Martin Luther King Jr. documentary also looks at the FBI surveillance of MLK, the events leading to his assassination in Memphis in 1968, and the impact of his death on American history and the global struggle for civil rights and equality.

items.title: Flight MH17 - Anatomy of a crash | DW Documentary
items.author: DW Documentary
items.content:
<article>In the summer of 2014, fields and coal mines in eastern Ukraine became a crime scene. The wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 was scattered across 12 square kilometers. Evidence of a war crime that remains unpunished to this day.

On July 17, 2014, the Malaysian Boeing 777 with flight number MH17 was en route from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur, carrying 283 passengers and 15 crew members. The plane was shot down by a Russian BUK missile as it flew over eastern Ukraine, where war broke out in 2014. 

This documentary reflects on the tragedy of MH17. The film consists of archive material, intercepted telephone conversations, open-source material, excerpts from television broadcasts, and staged fictional episodes. By combining different materials into a comprehensive collage, the film sheds light on the crash and examines the connections between propaganda, justice, punishment, and the far-reaching consequences of actions. 

While the film revolves around the story of MH17, it also approaches the subject on a very personal level ‚Äî including a meeting with a Dutch relative of one of the victims on the plane. By making connections to what is happening in Ukraine today, the film sheds light on the global repercussions of this crime. 

The film views the tragic events of July 17, 2014 from different perspectives and at different points in time, linking the crimes of the past with the present.

items.title: The Insane Submarine that Outran Torpedoes
items.author: Mustard
items.content:
<article>Get Nebula for 50% off using my link: https://go.nebula.tv/mustard

Watch Unsealed Episode 1 here: https://nebula.tv/videos/mustard-unsealed-episode-1-underwater-fighter-jet

Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/MustardChannel
Mustard Store: https://mustardchannel.com/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mustard_channel
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/MustardVideos
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Mustard-109952378202335

By the late 1950s, it was becoming clear to Soviet naval planners that the United States was winning the battle beneath the world‚Äôs oceans.

Over the previous decade, American engineers had developed sophisticated silencing technologies that made the latest generation of submarines so stealthy, they could track Soviet subs for hours, and sometimes days, without being detected. For Soviet naval planners, a nightmare scenario was unfolding. If war broke out, American submarines could find and destroy Soviet submarines before they had a chance to strike back.

Simply catching up to American stealth wasn't an option. It wasn't a technology that could easily be copied, it was the result of decades of precision manufacturing, relentless quality control, advances in materials science, and industrial discipline that the Soviet system couldn't support at the time. It would take decades to catch up.

Faced with a widening stealth technology gap, Soviet planners stopped trying to play hide and seek under the oceans, and instead chose raw power. They would bet everything on speed, depth, maneuverability and brute force.

In 1960, the Soviet Union launched their most ambitious submarine programs in history. Project 705 ‚ÄòLira‚Äô, later designated as the ‚ÄòAlfa Class‚Äô submarine by NATO, was a nuclear-powered attack submarine capable of outrunning torpedoes, executing extreme maneuvers, and diving deeper than anything the world had ever seen. Built with a revolutionary liquid-metal nuclear reactor, advanced automation, and a titanium hull, this machine represented a generational leap in engineering.
It wasn‚Äôt just a faster submarine, it was a radical attempt to rewrite the rules of underwater warfare.

When Western intelligence realized what the Soviets were building, it caused immediate panic. A submarine that could outrun torpedoes and dive beyond existing weapons threatened to upend NATO‚Äôs entire anti-submarine strategy, forcing the West into a sudden scramble to catch up.

But Project 705, a super submarine meant to restore balance beneath the seas, would prove to be far more than the Soviets ever bargained for.

Thanks for watching!</article>

items.title: My son was killed - A mother's journey through grief | DW Documentary
items.author: DW Documentary
items.content:
<article>In June 2024, Joanna lost her 20-year-old son Philippos. He was beaten up by another young man, following his sister's high school graduation party. Two days later, he died. The alleged perpetrator, a 19-year-old Syrian, was arrested.

A summer evening that ended in disaster. After his sister's high school graduation party, 20-year-old Philippos was brutally attacked in the German town of Bad Oeynhausen.

As his mother Joanna was mourning her son, Philippos became headline news. Before long, his death was used to reignite the debate on Germany‚Äôs asylum policy. Both in the German parliament, and in the media. 

Philippos' mother did not participate in this discussion. For her, the nationality of the perpetrator was irrelevant. "The doctor who fought for my child's life is Syrian," she said. "So is my hairdresser. And me? I'm Polish.‚Äù

Instead, Joanna, who is deeply religious, tried to find a way to deal with her anger, rage, despair, and grief. She sought advice from a prison psychologist and a priest: Why did Philippos have to die? Am I allowed to be angry with the perpetrator? Do I have to forgive him?

She sat opposite the defendant at the Bielefeld Regional Court, endured the police reports and witness statements, listened to the autopsy results from the forensic pathologists, and witnessed the images of her dead child on the dissection table.

"Even hearing the incomprehensible, the painful, knowing how Philippos died... I owe that to my child," she said.

DESCRIPTION
Matt Godbolt, creator of Compiler Explorer, interviews Daniel Kusswurm, author of "Modern X86 Assembly Language Programming", about the enduring relevance of assembly language in modern software development. They explore what SIMD (Single Instruction, Multiple Data) is and why it enables dramatic performance improvements for specific computational tasks, discuss when assembly language programming is justified versus using compiler intrinsics, and examine the challenges of writing vectorized algorithms. Dan shares insights from his career optimizing image analysis software and explains how understanding low-level architecture can improve code quality even when writing in higher-level languages.

items.title: A Brief History Of Greenland (And Why Trump Wants To Control It)
items.author: History Hit
items.content:
<article>Greenland, the world's largest island, is at the centre of a rapidly heating geopolitical struggle.

In this video, historian Matt Lewis breaks down the brief history of Greenland, from its Indigenous Inuit origins and Norse settlements to Danish rule and modern self-governance. But history is only half the story. The real question is why the United States cares so much about Greenland right now.

As climate change melts Arctic ice, Greenland is no longer just the world‚Äôs largest island‚Äîit‚Äôs a strategic goldmine. New shipping routes, untapped rare earth minerals, and massive energy potential are turning the Arctic into the next great power competition zone. The U.S., China, and Russia are all watching closely, but America‚Äôs interest in Greenland goes back decades, from Cold War military bases to recent, very public attempts to increase influence.

items.title: Inside the 'Woman, Life, Freedom' protest movement in Iran | DW Documentary
items.author: DW Documentary
items.content:
<article>Filmed in secret, this documentary is a behind-the-scenes look at the "Woman, Life, Freedom‚Äù uprising in Iran. The story begins a few weeks after the death of Jina Mahsa Amini, a young Kurdish student who died on 16 September 2022.

She had allowed a few strands of hair to escape from her veil. Members of the Iranian morality police beat her so severely that she died of her injuries. The regime in Tehran has denied all responsibility for her death, which triggered nationwide mass protests under a slogan that echoed all around the world: "Woman, Life, Freedom‚Äù.

Iranian filmmaker Shorresh Afkari filmed in secret, smuggling the footage out of the country to a colleague in France. His documentary gives a voice to people who, like large sections of the Iranian population, have run out of strength and patience.

For example, the film observes a young couple who dream of being able to express their love openly and in complete freedom. We also meet a taxi driver, who ends up in prison as a bitter opponent of the regime. His mother tries to protect him at all costs. A painter continues to practise her art despite censorship; a doctor secretly treats demonstrators. A young man is prepared to do anything for cash, even sell one of his kidneys. Just like men who dare to protest, women who show their hair in public and publicly oppose the regime still face harsh punishment, including the death penalty. For this reason, many interviewees speak off-camera to protect their anonymity.

The widespread protests and mass demonstrations that began shortly before the end of 2025 and continue to this day show that large parts of the population no longer support the regime in Tehran ‚Äî a regime that continues to respond with brutality against the people of Iran.

#documentary #dwdocumentary #dwdocs #iran #protest #womanlifefreedom

items.title: Kiranmala: The tale of the princess who conquered Magic Mountain - Malay Bera
items.author: TED-Ed
items.content:
<article>Dig into the Bengali tale of a trio of siblings who attempt to scale the fearsome Magic Mountain to gain treasures for their home.

--

Inspired by a king‚Äôs visit, a trio of siblings began building a palace, traveling far and wide to collect rare jewels, seeds, and marble. A holy man stopped by and told them of a Magic Mountain, east of north and north of east, where they‚Äôd find their most meaningful treasures. But, he said, only a true hero could complete the journey. Malay Bera shares the Bengali tale of Kiranmala's quest.

Lesson by Malay Bera, directed by H√©lo√Øse Dorsan-Rachet.

Although this folktale exists in multiple oral variants across the Bengali-speaking world, this video is based on a variant akin to the better-known literary version, ‚ÄúKironmala", from Thakurmar Jhuli (1907), an anthology of Bengali folktales collected by Dakshinaranjan Mitra Majumdar in the early 20th century.
